article.title: The VIMOS Ultra Deep Survey: The role of HI kinematics and HI column density on the escape of Lyalpha photons in star-forming galaxies at 2<z<4

choices: The distribution of star formation rates for Lya+CIII] emitters and all VUDS Lya emitters.
The distribution of various properties for Lya+CIII] emitters and all VUDS Lya emitters.
The correlation between redshift and Lya equivalent width for Lya+CIII] emitters.
The distribution of dust reddening values for Lya+CIII] emitters.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion drawn from this figure?
choices: Lya+CIII] emitters are preferentially located in overdense regions.
Lya+CIII] emitters are characterized by extreme values of SFR surface density.
The Lya+CIII] emitter sample occupies the low-mass end of the star-forming galaxy population.
There is a strong correlation between stellar mass surface density and star formation rate surface density for Lya+CIII] emitters.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the green vertical line in this figure represent?
choices: The wavelength of the SiII1526 absorption line at the VUDS redshift.
The wavelength of the CIII]1908 emission line at the VUDS redshift.
The systemic redshift of the galaxy.
The wavelength of the Lya emission line at the VUDS redshift.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of fitting both symmetric and asymmetric Gaussian functions to the Lya emission line?
choices: To determine if the Lya emission line is broadened by outflows.
To accurately measure the Lya peak shift and its uncertainties.
To estimate the HI column density from the shape of the Lya emission line.
To account for the presence of dust absorption in the Lya emission line.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this figure illustrate regarding the Lya emission and the UV continuum?
choices: The UV continuum is more spatially extended than the Lya emission.
The Lya emission is more spatially extended than the UV continuum.
The Lya emission and UV continuum have similar spatial extensions.
The Lya emission is always centered on the galaxy, while the UV continuum can be offset.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Av(SiII) in this equation represent?
choices: The velocity offset between the SiII absorption line and the systemic redshift.
The velocity of the outflowing HI gas.
The HI column density.
The Lya peak shift.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main trend observed in this figure?
choices: A positive correlation between Lya equivalent width and Lya spatial extension.
An anti-correlation between Lya equivalent width and Lya spatial extension.
No correlation between Lya equivalent width and Lya spatial extension.
A positive correlation between Lya equivalent width and Lya peak shift.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the effect of increasing the HI column density on the Lya emission line, as shown in this figure?
choices: The Lya peak becomes less red-shifted.
The Lya peak becomes more red-shifted.
The Lya emission line becomes narrower.
The Lya emission line becomes less affected by outflows.
